Back from Gaza, doctors question Europe's torpor: 'Do we still have any humanity left?'
subhead: Five doctors and two nurses from France and Switzerland who carried out several humanitarian missions in Gaza since November 2023 spoke to Le Monde about the impossibility of meeting the population's needs and how the experience left a lasting mark on them.

title: A tense power-sharing coalition takes shape in Poland
subhead: With the swearing-in of nationalist Karol Nawrocki as president on Wednesday, the center-right prime minister, Donald Tusk, faces the prospect of a particularly contentious working relationship.

title: Israel raises threat of Gaza occupation
subhead: As Benjamin Netanyahu convened a security council meeting on Tuesday, Israeli media discussed the possibility of a larger, even total, occupation of the enclave. This would be a turning point with far-reaching consequences.

title: French man arrested in Slovenia for crimes committed in Croatia during 1991 war
subhead: A French citizen originally from the former Yugoslavia has been imprisoned for three months and is facing extradition to Croatia. His lawyers condemned this as a violation of his rights. His family members in France fear 'revenge' for contested events.
byline: By Stéphanie Maupas (The Hague (Netherlands) correspondent) and Richard Schittly (Lyon (France) correspondent)

title: 2026 budget: PM Bayrou stands alone in the spotlight to defend his unpopular measures
subhead: French Prime Minister François Bayrou released a YouTube video on Tuesday titled 'FB Direct.' In the 'direct communication' operation, he amplified the threat of 'overindebtedness,' calling it 'an evil' threat to France's 'survival.'

title: Sydney Sweeney's American Eagle ad sparks controversy online and pleases Donald Trump
subhead: With a slogan playing on the ambiguity between 'genes' and 'jeans' − 'Sydney Sweeney has great jeans' − the actress has sparked controversy. Some have accused her of promoting eugenics, while President Donald Trump has come to American Eagle's defense, triggering a surge in its stock price.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Agnès Varda's Parisian wanderings at the Musée Carnavalet
